page.title: 18Unemployment in Hartlepool
page.content: Full employment in Hartlepool has not been known for many years. There has always been a higher than national average of the people of Hartlepool unemployed, but over the past few years the problem has become more and more acute to the point where Hartlepool now has one of the, if not the, highest percentages of people unemployed in the country. Apart from the national trend of unemployment, another major reason for Hartlepools abnormally high rate is the run down and disappearance of its heavy industries i.e., shipbuilding and iron and steel, which were highly labour intensive. In their place there has been an attempt to introduce lots of smaller manufacturing units not labour intensive but producing a wider range of goods. To a small extent this has been successful.
